questions.question:
Answer the questions given below (refer Fig.1):


Fig. 1. Circuit diagram of single-phase bridge inverter.


1. In a single-phase inverter, at any given instant how many switches are turned - ON?

explanations.b: Explanation 2: In a single-phase inverter, at any given instant, two switches (one from each leg) are turned ON.

questions.question: 2. What is output voltage when switch “S<sub>2</sub>” and “S<sub>4</sub>” are turned “ON”

explanations.a: Explanation 1: Output voltage is zero as these switches short the load terminals.

explanations.b: Explanation 2: The functionality of an inverter is to convert DC into AC.

questions.question: 4. In single-phase inverter, gate pulse is available for switches “S<sub>1</sub>” and “S<sub>2</sub>” when

answers.a: Carrier is greater than reference signal
answers.b: Reference is greater than carrier signal

explanations.b: Explanation 2: The PWM signals/scheme for the single-phase inverter is generated by comparing the reference with carrier signal and hence reference signal should be higher than carrier signal.
